instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CPU_VCORE: What is CPU_VCORE? Power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins for 3 sec
threads.message:
Hi ,

This is not a liquied dmged board.
resi
I get cpu <SIGNAL>V_CORE</SIGNAL> for 3 secs with fan spining then no <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>. I replaced the SMC, Tried with same board different bios isl 625 and current sensing resistors . Still the same. any clue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins for 3 sec
threads.message:
Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?
Pin 3/<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> goes high in these 3s?
Also check if <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> reacts.
Check if all voltages from page 58 come on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins for 3 sec
threads.message:
Thank you for your reply.

Pin 3/U/1950 goes to 3.3v for 3sec and also <SIGNAL>PT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes 3.3v only for that fan spining 3 secs. I dont know how to bypass SMC. 
I checked with same <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bios to see whether it turns on but same situation. I check with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> bios then I get continue fan spining no chime no display.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins for 3 sec
threads.message:
Then reflash original, don't waste time trying 3437 file.

SMC bypass has already been explained here several times; even Google helps you...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins for 3 sec
threads.message: solder wire on <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 for SMC bypass still same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins for 3 sec
threads.message:
Did the fan spin at max when you tried?
If not, wasn't in SMC bypass mode...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins for 3 sec
threads.message: yes fan whent max high speed then stop as before.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins for 3 sec
threads.message:
Then should be some CPU issue.
Check if you get correct all voltages on the L/C blocks near CPU; at the edge of the board.

"Check if all voltages from page 58 come on."
Don't forget...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins for 3 sec
threads.message:
Hi,
Thank you for your reply. Sorry couldnt mention I did check all the power rails and all are exactly the way it should be including <SIGNAL>CPU_VCORE</SIGNAL>. checed voltages on Blocks newar CPU edge of the board and they are getting the voltage suppose to get. Do you think this is CPU by itself?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Fan Spins for 3 sec
threads.message:
Could be anything else, like just a small resistor.
But is probably internal CPU problem...
